intro: Kohleria spicata var. hispida, commonly known as the hairy kohleria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically red or orange in color. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and requires well-draining soil. Kohleria spicata var. hispida is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
